alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Franklin; Licking (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 12 at 8:06PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...The following counties, in Central Ohio, Fairfield, Franklin OH and Licking. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 805 PM EDT, Radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Columbus, Dublin, Westerville, Reynoldsburg, Grove City, Upper Arlington, Gahanna, Hilliard, Pickerington, Worthington, Bexley, Pataskala, Canal Winchester, Groveport, Minerva Park, Easton, Summit Station, Ohio State University, Beechwood Trails and Whitehall.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
